meanings.definition: Somewhat old in age or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The man had an oldish face with deep wrinkles.
meanings.sent2: She wore an oldish dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The oldish cat tried to chase a mouse but ended up taking a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The oldish building stood tall, a relic of the past.
meanings.sent5: The oldish tree's branches creaked in the wind, showing its age.

meanings.definition: Of an age that is not young but not very old either.
meanings.sent1: The oldish car still ran smoothly despite its age.
meanings.sent2: He had an oldish look about him, not quite young but not quite old.
meanings.sent3: The oldish puppy wagged its tail happily, full of energy.
meanings.sent4: The oldish book had been read many times, its pages worn and loved.
meanings.sent5: The oldish house on the corner had a cozy feel, welcoming all who passed by.
